  {panel}

h3. Problem definition
It is important for all the organizations to greet the customer in best way when customers show up physically.
Why not having it on customer portal since we attend customers on the cyber space?

In addition to this, it would be great if users can easily see their username on every page they navigate to. Now they will have to click on their own profile to see their own user page

h3. Solution
* Having a simple greeting message, i.e. Hello [username] or Welcome [username] on the JIRA Service desk Customer Portal. 
* Also have a small greeting message at every page of the Customer Portal which clearly shows the username (eg. Something like Sysnexsys uses in [this example|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22655745/customer-portal-welcome-message])
fields.summary: Greeting(Welcome) Message - Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2152].
  {panel}

I was redirected here from the Developer Relations site (ecosystem). This isn't really a Bug or Suggestion, but we need support help with this question:

Our scenario:
* JIRA is available from the Internet though an Apache httpd web proxy
* We have a multi-tenant JIRA instance. Each tenant has their own Service Desk
* JIRA Service Desks are opened up to anyone (anyone can sign up) because the tenants don't know which of their users will access the Service Desk

Using Apache Allow/Deny directives, we tried to restrict certain Service Desks to specfic source networks (or redirect to another page). For example:
{code}
<Location /jira/servicedesk/customer/portal/1>
  Order deny,allow
  Deny from all
  Allow from aaa.bbb.ccc
</Location>

<Location /jira/servicedesk/customer/portal/2>
  Order deny,allow
  Deny from all
  Allow from xxx.yyy.zzz
</Location>
{code}

However, this doesn't work because of the Single Page App nature of JIRA Service Desk. That is, if we type the URL directly into the address bar, the Apache web proxy will honor my Deny statements and block as appropriate. But if I link to those pages from directly within the app, the Single Page App bypasses the web server and the pages are not blocked.

We would like to know if there is some other way to restrict specific Service Desks to certain source networks.

We would also like to block or redirect the "Help Center" page from all users.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Blocking/Redirecting Service Desks and Help Center via Web Proxy

fields.description:
*Steps to the problem:*
1. gg + Attachments
2. Do the setting on "Attachment Size" (e.g. 10MB)
3. 
- Attach a big file (>10MB) to a JIRA issue/ Service Desk request in Agent view, there is an error message about exceeding the maximum size
!"Screen Shot 2015-07-29 at 3.09.13 PM.png"|thumbnail!

- Attach a big file to a Service Desk request in Customer Request, there is a different error message but with the same warning
!Screen Shot 2015-07-29 at 3.11.53 PM.png|thumbnail!

4. A Service Desk customer sends an email with a big attachment (>10MB) to create a request to Service Desk team.

*Actual behavior:*
The request can be created successfully (which is one of the reason causing JSD-2082)

*Expected behavior:*
Creating a request via email channel should respect global setting for Attachment.
fields.summary: Creating request via email doesn't respect Attachment settings in System

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2147].
  {panel}

As an administrator, I would like the ability to allow my customers to add one or more email addresses to a issue and have these email addresses receive issue notifications. 
* It should not matter if the email address is not attached to a customer. I want my customers to be able to add email addresses without new customers needing to be created

h5. Example Use Case
* My customer would like to add the address of an email alias to receive notifications when the issue is updated. 


{panel:title=Atlassian update - 7th Aug 2015}
Hi All,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request.

After analysis of this issue we decided it is not something we can put on our short to mid term roadmap. Therefore we think it is only fair to not keep this issue as open and close it as "won't fix". We will take this feedback into account as we work on ongoing design and functionality improvements to Email.


Cheers,
Joseph
JIRA Service Desk Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow customer to add non-customer email address to receive issue notifications

As a workaround to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-270
Service Desk administrators usually set the Browse permission to the Service Desk project allowed to Anyone, doing so, customers will be able to see request reported by other customers.

However, the "Anyone" permission will make visible the internal comments, since these internal comments are JIRA standard comments, and users will access in the issue should be able to see.

As a Service Desk Administrator, I would like to hide my internal comments, even from users with browse permission.
fields.summary: Internal Comment should not be visible by anonymous user

SLA value should update based on the current project and ticket status.

fields.description:
h5. Experienced Behavior 

In the JIRA Service Desk Customer portal, when a user accesses the my request page, the default is "All Requests"
* Prior to 2.5.0 the default was "Open Requests" 
* Since version 2.5.0 the default is "All Requests"

h5. Expected Behavior 

When a user accesses the my request page the default is "Open Requests"

h5. Workaround
* While it is not possible to change the dropdown default, "Open requests" can be accessed directly via URL:
**  http://JIRA_HOME/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?status=open

---- 

A related issue suggestion, JSD-1594, seeks to make it so users can set their own default
fields.summary: Default Filter in My Request Page is no longer "Open Requests"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a mail channel to a request type in JIRA Service Desk, the following error gets displayed in the screen:
{code}
Unable to create new mail channel due to connection duplication. Provided mail connection definition is currently used by another mail channel.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue type in JIRA
# Create a new request type in Service Desk and link it to the issue type of step 1
# Add a mail channel for the request type created in step 2
# Remove the issue type created in step 1 from the project configuration
# Add a new mail channel for another request type in a Service Desk using the same mail credentials as in step 3

h3. Expected Results
The mail channel gets added

h3. Actual Results
The following error shows in the UI after choosing the request type to which the mail channel should relate:
{code}
Unable to create new mail channel due to connection duplication. Provided mail connection definition is currently used by another mail channel.
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
# Navigate to the email settings of your instance by going to {{baseurl/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa}}.
Here you should be able to find the email address already being present that you are trying to add
# Use the delete option to remove the channel from the instance
# Recreate the mail channel from within the service desk
fields.summary: When adding a mail channel, the message "Unable to create new mail channel due to connection duplication" appears

h4. Summary
Trying to add a non-service-desk-customer into the participant list even though the Service Desk is public and *Anyone can sign up for a [customer account|http://docs.atlassian.com/servicedesk/docs-025/Configuring+public+signup] on my Customer Portal* option is enabled

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Raise a request into the Customer Portal
# Click on the *+Add People* button to add a participants
# Insert an email that has not been registered as Service Desk customer

h4. Expected Results
Service Desk will send a notification email that the user should sign up to view the request in Service Desk Customer Portal

h4. Actual Results
{quote}Could not find an account for user@email.com, or they cannot be added to this request{quote}
message is shown, and the requested participant(s) not added

h4. Notes
Is this a bug or expected behavior? If this is a Feature Request, then it's gonna be:
{quote}As an agent or customer, I would like to add participants who is not already in the Service Desk Customer list{quote}

h4. Workaround
Invite user first before adding them as participant

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2121].
  {panel}

When configuring service desk automation I would like the ability to select a group instead of an individual user when using the Alert User THEN statements. 

Currently you can add multiple users but not a particular group when using THEN statements

*Example:*
Client needs help with a payroll issue. They file a Payroll Help ticket using one of the many forms linked to that Issue Type. That issue type is linked to a special workflow my desk is using that fires off a "Payroll Help Event Created" event for listeners to consume. Then using the notifications settings, I have the Payroll Help SD Team project role get notified whenever that event is fired.

I have this happening for about 4-5 different issue types for different aspects of the company (we do this one-desk solution so that our non-technical users aren't turned off using the system by having to go to multiple desks). I noticed the new automation feature allows you to send notifications based on issue type, but it's only on a per-user basis. I could conceivably add multiple users, condense my workflows and switch to using the automation feature while managing the user notifications on a per-user basis, but I prefer having the ability to manage all of my users via JIRA groups and/or project roles, as single-user management gets incredibly messy and hard to keep track of. So what I'd really love is for the @user functionality for automation to be expanded to Project Role or JIRA group. Project role would be preferred.

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using a Collaborator account to modify issues in a Service Desk project via API, users won't see a permissions error response - the operation will fail silently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Service Desk project.
# Set up a user account with full access to the Service Desk project, but without the Service Desk Agent permissions.
# Use API authenticating with the account from point 2 to attempt to modify an issue in the Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results
API call returns an error about the missing agent permission.

h3. Actual Results
The API response (201) indicates that the call is successful - it's only based on JIRA permissions and doesn't account for the Service Desk permissions override.
 
h3. Notes
Checking the Permission Helper indicates that the Collaborator account won't be able to edit the issue:
{quote}You are trying to perform an agent action on a service desk project. To perform this action, you must have a Service Desk agent license and both Browse and Edit Issue permissions on this project.{quote}
This information should be included in the API response.

h3.Workaround
Grant the API user Service Desk agent permissions.
fields.summary: API Responses Don't Account for Service Desk Permission Override

As an administrator of Jira Service Desk, I'd like to enable more than one project to be visible in Service Desk itself. My team of support specialists now need to work with more than one Service Desk plus Jira dashboards which makes work inefficient. It also makes work load intransparent.

FYI: This is not a duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-52 as I am not asking for multiple projects in the Customer Portal front end but for multiple projects in the Service Desk back end.

{panel:title=Update as of 6 October 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,
Could you specify the use cases with more details?
# Is it the same team working on multiple projects? Or multiple teams? What are the projects used for?
# When does your agent need to refer to both the queues and the dashboards, or even potentially boards or filters?
# What would you like to achieve by having a service desk working across multiple projects?

Thanks!
The JIRA Service Desk team
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

- Add a user who uses a hotmail account.
- Let the user create a mail and reply to it.
- Should the user reply directly to your reply from his mail client, then the old mails would be added into the email as well.

*Expected Behaviour*
- Service Desk would strip the quotes from old messages.

First of all, we don't need a multi-lingual service desk because we create service desks per country. (Ok, we omit the fact that we have to serve multi-lingual countries but that's ok for now).

At least, we require the possibility to be able to set a default language on a per-project level.

It seems that new customers (public service desk with email queue) are created with Jira's system default language. It'd be great if this would rather be the default language defined for that project/service desk.

In addition, the customer should have the chance to change the language setting. This is not possible at the moment and suggested workarounds are impractical (temporary assigning group jira-users, updating Jira's database directly).

And to go even further, it'd be great if any email notifications that are sent out to the customer are sent in the customer's language - not the language of the current support team member who triggered the notification.

  {panel}

*Problem:*
The transition list in the automation rule 'Transition on Comment' only shows the first transition when this transition name occurs more than once.

*Example:*
The workflow linked to my Service Desk project contains two times 'Start Progress' (see screenshot: ID 741 and ID 24). When I select the rule's transition list, it shows only one Start Progress (see screenshot).
My SD project uses the transition ID 24 (since it contains a condition project = string for my Service Desk project), the second 'Start Progress', and the rule didn't work.
Then I switched the order in the workflow (ID 24 first).
This made the rule work.
Apparently, when a transition name occurs more than once, the list only shows the first one.

*Solution:*
Can't the transitions be displayed by name + ID?

*Workaround:*
* switching the transitions is a temporary solution, because obviously it won't work for a project that uses the next transition.
* splitting up the workflows, but that would be too redundant.
fields.summary: Automation rule should display transition by name + ID

  {panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff | titleBGColor=#deebff | bgColor=#deebff}

Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue. 

After reviewing this suggestion we believe that it was resolved in [JSD 4.8|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-desk-4-8-x-release-notes-996707738.html#JiraServiceDesk4.8.xreleasenotes-declutter] with the introduction of duplicate attachment detection:

bq. When customers raise requests over email, the email body is added to the request’s description. This often includes some unwanted media like marketing images, company logos, and everything else from the email’s footer. With every new comment or update, these images get duplicated, making it difficult to find anything important. We’ve heard your feedback and changed it—Jira Service Desk will now detect and ignore any duplicates, leaving your requests nice and clean.

Please provide further details if there are additional use cases you would like us to consider in relation to image attachments.

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center

{panel}

When you use the JSD with the email channel and someone with pictures in their signature sends in a issue.

Then it will add the pictures as attachments and as a comment with the pictures.

It would be nice to be able to remove signatures (including pictures) or be able to remove pictures in the body of the mail and only receive the pictures attached to the email
fields.summary: Be able to remove images in mail body

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2089].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Create a new Service Desk project.
2. Add an automation rule with the following setup:
* *WHEN*: Issue created
* *IF*: Issue matches - Issue Type is "IT Help"
* *THEN*: Transition issue to {{Respond to customer}}

3. Add the "Attachment" field to the IT Help type on the customer portal.
4. Create two issues via Service Desk > Create a Service Desk Request, one with an attachment and one without (the attachment can be anything, I've been using a text file containing the word "test").

h3. Expected results
Both issues will be transitioned to {{Waiting for customer}}.

h3. Actual results
The issue with no attachment transitions correctly, but the issue with the attachment remains in {{Waiting for support}}.
# The Customer Request view says "Your request status changed to Requester action Needed" but the status isn't updated to match: [^request.png] 
# In the database, the status actually shows that its in {{Waiting For Support}}, but the transitions on the issue shows that its in {{Waiting for Customer}}. See [^TransitionsAreIncorrect.png]
# The transition seems to have activated for a second or less, before reverting back to {{Waiting For Support}}. If you have the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin installed, you can actually see the status *was* in {{Waiting for Customer}} for one second. See [^JSUTransitions.png]
# Running the Integrity Checker for workflows shows us exactly what the problem is: [^IntegrityChecker.png] the workflow current step have been corrupted by the automation due to the attachment bug. The integrity checker is able to fix it. 

h3. Workaround
Remove the *Attachment* from the Visible Fields form so that users are forced to attach their files after the requests have been created.
Considering the same data from the *Steps to Reproduce* section, the workaround can be applied with the steps below:
# Navigate to the desired Service Desk configuration screen.
# Go to *Settings > Request Types*.
# Select *IT Help > Edit fields*.
# In the *Visible fields* section, remove the *Attachment* field.
fields.summary: Automation rule to transition issues upon creation fails and causes workflow corruption if there's an attachment included

h2.Summary
Hidden fields that can't be shown on the Customer Portal, doesn't set the default value when request is created by customers.
These type of fields are displayed with the "Show" option greyed out under Service Desk "Request Types" section.
Hovering over the "Show" option displays the message: *"This field type can't be displayed in Customer Portal"*
e.g fields: Epic Link, Assignee

This affects Issues Created by the Customer Portal as well as Email

h2.Step to Replicate
# Under a *Request Type* configure the screen and add Epic Link as a hidden field.
# Set the default value of the Epic Link to an existing epic link.
# Login as a SD Customer (or create a new one for testing purposes); raise a request with the above request type. 
*Expected Result:* Epic Link field is set to the default epic link and shown at JIRA ticket view screen.
*Current Result:* Epic link field is empty and thus not showing on the JIRA ticket view screen.

h2.Notes
The problem doesn't affect agents.
The event that sets these fields requires edit permissions for the field and so it fails when Customers don't meet those requirements.

JIRA logs the following warning:

2015-08-26 10:19:06,507 Caesium-1-4 WARN email@address.com     [c.a.jira.ofbiz.ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor] Dangerous use of multiple connections: taken => count=3; marks=[3-3]; pool=3/-1
java.lang.AssertionError: Explicit stack trace requested
      at com.atlassian.jira.util.log.RateLimitingLogger.warnWithTrace(RateLimitingLogger.java:163)
...
{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2074].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When JIRA instance uses other Default System Language, for example German (Deutsch), Service Desk notification will mix both English and German language in the email.

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.3.15
JSD 2.3.6
JSD 2.6.0-OD-11

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA with Service Desk
# Set Default User Preference to use *Text* based email notification
# Change *Indexing Language* and *Default Language* to German (Deutsch)
# Create a Service Desk Request on behalf of customer

h4. Expected Results
Email notification will be fully in German language

h4. Actual Results
There will be a mixed of English and German language in the email
!english.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
# The problem *is not observed anymore* in the latest JIRA and Service Desk Server version.
JIRA 6.4.x
JSD 2.5.0
!german.png|thumbnail!
# HTML format email is also showing the translation correctly. Only the Text format is broken
# This is still happening on Cloud instances
# On JIRA Server the issue is happening again in JIRA 7.0.4 and JSD 3.0.4.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2073].
  {panel}

As a JIRA administrator I have all of the users defined in my instance placed in groups so that I can manage them more easily. 

To support this it would be ideal if you could specify on a per service desk basis which groups an invited customer should be added to.

IE: 

* Service Desk 1 has default group for invited customers of customers-service-desk-1
* Service Desk 2 has default group for invited customers of customers-service-desk-2

h3. Advantages of this method:
Makes it easy for me to determine which groups should be allowed access to what, as my support desk agents do not have capacity to deal with user management.
fields.summary: Auto add users invited to a service desk to a group configurable by individual service desk

fields.description:
This is happening to me on 2.5.0

It was working fine, but then I disabled and re-enabled the plugin and since then SLA is broken. All requests go into paused state.

I have not modified the SLA or workflow and can confirm it was definitely working before I disabled the plugin.

I can't confirm for definite it was caused by disable/re-enable plugin, but that seems to be the only thing I could possibly link this to.

Blocker - SLA is broken.

Note: I disabled the plugin to confirm it was Service Desk that was causing the error in Agile before I located JSD-2016 .

h4. Summary
In JIRA Service Desk 2.5.0, The default time to resolution metric is configured as the following:
- START: Issue created, Resolution: Cleared
- PAUSE ON: 
- STOP: Resolution: Set
However, when the issue gets created, the SLA is on pause. If user configures a new metric for SLA, it will work properly.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a Service Desk
- Using the default configuration of SLA (Time to Resolution metric), create issue
- Everything OK
- Disable the Service Desk plugin
- Enable the Service Desk plugin
- Create a Service Desk issue
- The SLA will be on pause, while it should start

h4. Expected Behavior
When the issue gets created, the SLA should start.



-- From Cloned Issue --

h4. Summary
In JIRA Service Desk 2.2.0, The default time to resolution metric is configured as the following:
- START: Issue created, Resolution: Cleared
- PAUSE ON: 
- STOP: Resolution: Set
However, when the issue gets created, the SLA is on pause. If user configures a new metric for SLA, it will work properly.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a Service Desk
- Using the default configuration of SLA (Time to Resolution metric), create issue
- The SLA will be on pause, while it should start

h4. Expected Behavior
When the issue gets created, the SLA should start.

h4. Additional Information
- It misbehaves in JIRA Service Desk 2.2.0 only
!sd22.png|thumbnail!
- It works properly in JIRA Service Desk 2.1.1
!sd21.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk 2.5.0 Default SLA Time to Resolution metric set SLA on pause when issue gets created

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Issue view links in Service Desk emails (ie. /servicedesk/customer/portal/1/TST-1) for issues that get created in one project and then are moved to another project no longer work in JSD 2.3.5 and beyond.  A page with the error "Failed to retrieve a project from the given issue" is displayed instead of the expected Service Desk issue view.

Example:
* Issue is created in one project and an email gets sent out with a link to that issue (/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/TST-5)
* Issue is moved to another project (new JSD issue view link is /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/TEST-9)
* First issue view link (/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/TST-5) now displays a page with the error "Failed to retrieve a project from the given issue"

This issue appears to be related to [this fix|https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/DESK-3590].
fields.summary: Issue view links in Service Desk emails for issues that get moved to another project no longer work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever an agent responds to a customer using the comment for instead of the workflow buttons at the top of the issue, Service Desk is sending 2 notifications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk request
# Respond to customer using the comment form instead of the workflow buttons.

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk notifies customer of the Agent response.

h3. Actual Results
Service Desk notifies customer twice, once as "Waiting for Support" and the second time as "Requester action needed".

h3. Workaround
Make the Agent use the Comment field in the *Respond to Customer* screen (while doing the transition with the *Respond to customer* button) instead of using the comment field in the View Issue screen. The customer will receive only one email as *Requester action Needed*.
fields.summary: Duplicate notification when agent responds to customer

h3. Problem Definition
[Service Desk Collaborators|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Collaborator] do not have the ability to access the Service Desk Customer Portal to collaborate (add comments and view) on issues

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for Service Desk Collaborators to use the Service Desk Customer Portal 
or 
Redirect the Service Desk Portal link to the internal JIRA URL; for example, instanceurl/servicedesk/agent/ServiceDesk/queues/2/ISSUE-1234 redirects to instanceurl/browse/ISSUE-1234 for Service Desk Collaborators 
 
h3. Workaround 
Service Desk Collaborators can only update issues from Project Pages
fields.summary: Allow Collaborators to Utilize Service Desk Portal to Manage Issues

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
Create a new Service Desk project
Associate with a JIRA Service Desk Mail handler
Let a customer create a new ticket
Let a agent add a new comment (the default automation setup will transition the issue to "Waiting for customer").

h4. Expect behavior
1) An email highlighting the comment (black text surrounded by the blue box, indicated by my second attachment)
2) An email indicating the status has changed.

h4. Actual behavior
The customer will receive two emails, both about the ticket being transitioned to another status, with the new comment in a *Previous activity* section. This make the response email to the customer confusing and less useful.

h4. Workaround
Make the Agent use the Comment field in the *Respond to Customer* screen (while doing the transition Respond to customer) instead of using the comment field in the View Issue screen.
fields.summary: Default notifications not highlighting comments from agents in the emails messages

*Request Summary*
Can Service Desk Automation be improved to allow further customizations?

- We would like to see a feature that allows users being assigned issue or one that allows user to pass values to fields that meet specific requirements set by the user.

*For example*
Emails that meet a specific scenario should be closed however because the close issue screen has required field that needs to be selected before the issue can be closed, the automation would always fail.
Allowing the user to pass value based on configuration would allow them automate something like this properly.
fields.summary: Improve available customization in Automation

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 30th Aug 2018}
Hello Server customers,
Great news - The ability to add transitions to the customer portal is available now! To find out more about this feature, check out our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/configuring-the-customer-portal-939926277.html#Configuringthecustomerportal-addTransitionsAddtransitionsl] 
On behalf of the JSD team, I want to thank all of you for your patience.
— JIRA Service Desk Team 

{panel}

h5. Issue Summary
Currently in JIRA, when a customer accesses a Service Desk portal, there is no close issue button nor is there a re-open issue button.

Currently all that is available is the feature to re-open issues when they comment on a resolved issue.

This prevents our customers from being able to close their own open issues and also doesn't provide a clear way to re-open issues.

Can something similar to the links provided in Service Desk be added?
fields.summary: Add Transition Links to Customer Portal

h5. Issue Summary
When a user translates his statuses in JIRA and sets his language to a preferred language, if he navigates to customer portal of Service Desk, some of the language change is not obeyed and this also affects emails sent by Service Desk to the users.

Attached are 2 Screenshots that can serve as samples:

h5. Actual Behaviour
